thread.title: College football week 8 rewind
thread.title_full: College football week 8 rewind - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: College football week 8 rewind
text:
Photo: John Raoux, Associated Press Image 1 of / 14 14 HIGHS
Around the area:
Houston, the program Sumlin left four years ago, is having no such troubles along Cullen Boulevard. The Cougars under first-year coach Tom Herman continued their steady climb through the rankings to No. 18 (from 21), following a 59-10 crushing of Central Florida on Saturday. The Cougars close out the regular season with four of five games at home, in a bid to go undefeated. Plenty of observers figured Herman, who last served as a whiz offensive coordinator at national champ Ohio State, would get UH headed in the right direction. Few figured it would be this quick. HIGHS
Around the area:
Houston, the program Sumlin left four years ago, is having no such troubles along Cullen Boulevard. The Cougars under first-year coach Tom Herman continued their steady climb ... more Image 2 of 14 Speaking of heading things in the right direction, Texas continued doing so with a 23-9 victory over Kansas State in Austin, two weeks after toppling then-No. 9 Oklahoma in Dallas. The Wildcats had defeated UT in six of their seven previous meetings, giving another Big 12 victory for the Longhorns even sweeter significance. Speaking of heading things in the right direction, Texas continued doing so with a 23-9 victory over Kansas State in Austin, two weeks after toppling then-No. 9 Oklahoma in Dallas. The Wildcats had defeated UT ... more Image 3 of 14 Rice receiver Zach Wright snagged a touchdown pass from Driphus Jackson with 24 seconds remaining to lift the Owls to a 38-31 victory over Army at Rice Stadium. His winning catch occurred the day after his mother, former Rice basketball player Holly Jones-Wright, was inducted into the Rice athletics hall of fame. Rice receiver Zach Wright snagged a touchdown pass from Driphus Jackson with 24 seconds remaining to lift the Owls to a 38-31 victory over Army at Rice Stadium. His winning catch occurred the day after his ... more Image 4 of 14 Around the nation
Georgia Tech’s Lance Austin returned a blocked field goal 78 yards on the final play of his team’s 22-16 upset of Florida State in Atlanta. Coach Paul Johnson had initially yelled at Austin to leave the rolling ball alone following the block, but in the end was thrilled by Austin’s disobedience that kept the game from going to overtime. Around the nation

Coach Paul Johnson had initially yelled at ... more Image 5 of 14 Oklahoma’s Samaje Perine and Joe Mixon combined for 355 rushing yards, including 201 by Perine, in the Sooners’ 63-27 stomping of Texas Tech in Norman, Okla. Perine added four touchdown runs to punctuate the Red Raiders’ misery against the league’s top teams (losses to TCU, Baylor and Oklahoma so far). Oklahoma’s Samaje Perine and Joe Mixon combined for 355 rushing yards, including 201 by Perine, in the Sooners’ 63-27 stomping of Texas Tech in Norman, Okla. Perine added four touchdown runs to punctuate ... more Image 6 of 14 LOWS
Around the area:
Baylor quarterback Seth Russell, a midseason Heisman Trophy candidate, fractured a bone in his neck and is scheduled to see a specialist this week. The No. 2 Bears are hopeful Russell might return this season, and meanwhile freshman Jarrett Stidham steps in to try and keep Baylor rolling. LOWS
Around the area:

The No. 2 Bears are hopeful ... more Image 7 of 14 A&M offensive lineman Germain Ifedi posted on his Twitter page following the Aggies’ stunning loss at Mississippi, “Rash generalizations without knowing the whole picture. Mmm.” No one outside of Ifedi is quite sure what it means, especially the “mmm,” but any kind of “picture” in this situation doesn’t sound good. A&M offensive lineman Germain Ifedi posted on his Twitter page following the Aggies’ stunning loss at Mississippi, “Rash generalizations without knowing the whole picture. Mmm.” No one outside of Ifedi is ... more Image 8 of 14 Around the nation:
Miami under beleaguered coach Al Golden suffered its worst loss in school history, 58-0, at the hands of a sympathetic Clemson squad. Sympathetic because the Tigers led 42-0 at halftime, and the final could have been worse for the Hurricanes. The historic loss cost Golden his job; he was relieved of his duties the following Sunday. Around the nation:

Sympathetic because the Tigers led 42-0 at halftime, ... more Image 9 of 14 Speaking of pretenders (see Texas A&M), Utah suffered its first loss of the season in humiliating fashion, 42-24 to previously-reeling Southern Cal and an interim coach. The Utes dropped 10 spots to No. 13 in the AP poll as a result. Speaking of pretenders (see Texas A&M), Utah suffered its first loss of the season in humiliating fashion, 42-24 to previously-reeling Southern Cal and an interim coach. The Utes dropped 10 spots to No. 13 in ... more Image 10 of 14 QUOTABLE
“If you’re a competitor, you love that test. And (the players) viewed it as a test. … We practiced overtime at camp. We made a big deal of it. We did the coin toss; we did the other sides of the field. … I didn’t think we were going to lose.”
Duke coach David Cutcliffe following the Blue Devils’ 45-43, four-overtime victory at Virginia Tech. QUOTABLE
“If you’re a competitor, you love that test. And (the players) viewed it as a test. … We practiced overtime at camp. We made a big deal of it. We did the coin toss; we did the other sides of ... more Image 11 of 14 HEISMAN WATCH
1. Leonard Fournette, LSU – The sophomore running back has been the frontrunner from the start – and only strengthened his case along the way. He collected 150 rushing yards on 26 carries against Western Kentucky, and has 1,352 yards on the ground a little more than midway through the season. HEISMAN WATCH
1. Leonard Fournette, LSU – The sophomore running back has been the frontrunner from the start – and only strengthened his case along the way. He collected 150 rushing yards on 26 carries ... more Image 12 of 14 2. Trevone Boykin, TCU – The No. 5 Horned Frogs didn’t play on Saturday, but their senior quarterback didn’t lose his place in line. Boykin ranks second nationally in total offense with 426 yards per game, and his talents will be on display on Thursday night on national TV against West Virginia. 2. Trevone Boykin, TCU – The No. 5 Horned Frogs didn’t play on Saturday, but their senior quarterback didn’t lose his place in line. Boykin ranks second nationally in total offense with 426 yards per ... more Image 13 of 14 3. Corey Coleman, Baylor – He set the school record for career touchdown catches with 31, breaking Kendall Wright’s 30 from 2008-11, and his 18 touchdown receptions this season already are more than anyone tallied last season. 3. Corey Coleman, Baylor – He set the school record for career touchdown catches with 31, breaking Kendall Wright’s 30 from 2008-11, and his 18 touchdown receptions this season already are more than anyone ... more Image 14 of 14 College football week 8 rewind 1 / 14 Back to Gallery Less than two weeks ago, Texas A&M was ranked ninth and the Aggies were kicking around the notion of a College Football Playoff appearance. By Saturday night A&M fans were simply kicking themselves for being duped by a faux contender in the SEC West.
The Aggies dropped out of the Associated Press top 25 poll on Sunday, following their second consecutive double-digit loss, this one more stunning than the previous. Mississippi whipped the Aggies 23-3 in Oxford, Miss., following A&M's 41-23 home loss to Alabama the week prior.
The Aggies also are left with a load of quarterback questions, after starter Kyle Allen was grossly ineffective over the first three quarters, and coach Kevin Sumlin replaced him with junior-college transfer Jake Hubenak, not touted freshman Kyler Murray.
Sumlin said the decision to skip over Murray was based on the prior week of practice. It should be an interesting coming week around the Coolidge practice fields, based on the drama enveloping the two-game losing streak.
COMING THIS WEEK
West Virginia at TCU, 6:30 p.m. Thursday
Louisiana Tech at Rice, 7 p.m. Friday
South Carolina at Texas A&M, 11 a.m. Saturday
College of Faith at Texas Southern, 1 p.m. Saturday
Arkansas-Pine Bluff at Prairie View A&M, 1 p.m. Saturday
Lamar at Houston Baptist, 2 p.m. Saturday
Texas at Iowa State, 6 p.m. Saturday
Texas A&M-Commerce at Sam Houston State, 6 p.m. Saturday
Vanderbilt at Houston, 6 p.m. Saturday
Florida vs. Georgia (Jacksonville, Fla.), 2:30 p.m. Saturday
Oklahoma State at Texas Tech, 2:30 p.m. Saturday
Notre Dame at Temple, 7 p.m. Saturday
